Description: Journalists found a Russian filtration camp for captured Ukrainians in Belarus - investigation by the Belarusian Investigative CenterAt the beginning of the full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the Russian military created a filtration camp on the territory of Belarus. Journalists found out that it was located on the basis of one of the buildings that belonged to a Belarusian state-owned enterprise -Pripyat Alliance- in Narovlya (Gomel region). Some human rights activists call this camp one of the most cruel against prisoners. Not only Ukrainian military personnel were taken there, but also civilians, including minors. But none of them shows how civilians were interrogated there. And they beat civilians there, God forbid... That is, screams were constantly heard there.- According to human rights activists, now some of the Ukrainians who passed through the filtration camp in Narovlya are still in captivity, in particular, on the territory of penal colonies in Russia.

Title: üñº The State Duma introduced criminal liability for theft and dat...
Description: The State Duma introduced criminal liability for theft and leaks of data of Russians. The first amendment concerned the bot for -breaking through-, which is used by security forcesToday, the State Duma unanimously adopted in the 2nd and 3rd final readings a package of bills that tightens administrative liability and introduces criminal liability for the leakage of personal data . -The punishment will directly depend on the volume of the leak: for legal entities it will range from 5 to 15 million rubles. In the event of a repeated leak, the company will have to pay a turnover fine: from 1 to 3% of its last year‚Äôs turnover. The toughest sanctions are provided for leaks of biometric personal data. In case of repeated violation, the fine will be up to 25 million to 0.5 billion rubles,- Deputy Khinshtein explained the procedure for fines. The law also introduces a prison sentence for the illegal use, collection, storage or transfer of personal data obtained illegally. Up to 4 years without aggravating circumstances and up to 10 years if the crime was committed by a group of people or resulted in grave consequences. Today, the administration of -Eyes of God-, the most popular bot for -breaking through- the personal data of Russians, responded to the amendments. According to the amendments, administering such a bot may be punishable by imprisonment. After the adoption of the law, the bot greatly reduced its functionality, ASTRA was convinced: from the -Eye of God- the output indicating the leaks used to break through, addresses, detailed search by full name without date of birth and many other functions disappeared.-With Today, the information in my systems is significantly limited.-‚Äî confirmed to the publication MSK1.ru creator of -Eyes of God- Evgeny Antipov. -Eye of God- -considered one of the most complete and loyal to the authorities: security forces do not hide the fact that they use it in operational work-, - wrote investigative journalist Andrey Zakharov. He added that the law adopted today by the State Duma is called by independent media the -law against investigative journalists-, since for many years they have been using data leaks and bots like the -Eyes of God- to investigate corruption and the activities of the Russian special services.

Title: üñº Russia recruited hundreds of Yemenis to participate in the war...
Description: Russia has recruited hundreds of Yemenis to participate in the war in Ukraine. Many were lured into the war by deceptionSince at least July 2024, Russia has been recruiting Yemenis to take part in the invasion of Ukraine, writes the British newspaper Financial Times with a link to an interview with mercenaries.  Yemen is a poor Muslim country in the south of the Arabian Peninsula that has been torn by civil war for 10 years. Payments for Russian contracts are huge amounts of money by the standards of this country, but even despite this, some Yemenis are recruited into the war by deception. Two of the newspaper's interlocutors, Yemenis Abdullah and Nabil recruited by Russia, said that they were lured into the war by deception. Abdullah thought he was flying to Russia to work in the drone industry. Nabil believed that he would be offered a job in the fields of -security- and -engineering.- Abdullah told reporters that when his group from Yemen refused to sign a contract with the Ministry of Defense, the military present at the scene fired a shot in the air so that the foreigners would still sign the contracts. According to the man, he was brought to the war by -scammers who traffic people.-Yemen is not the only country in the Global South whose residents are being deceived by Russia into sending them to fight in Ukraine. Thus, in the spring of this year, India reported, that there was a real -human trafficking network- in the countrythat sent Indians to Russia. Before this similar fraudhas flourished in Nepal.
